metadata.synopsis: Lorroakan's initial dialog with the player in Ramazith's tower, where he plans to have Nightsong imprisoned like Ketheric had. He will ask the player to deliver her to him.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Use debug book to teleport to Act 3 - > LOW - > Sorcerous Sundries --> Ramazith's TowerTemporary location: BGO_Main_A: -1769; 26; 599

3.speaker: Lorroakan
3.text: Hold very still, Miklaur - Krank's aim is much improved but still leaves something up to chance.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Lorroakan has an animated armour shooting an apple off a halfling's head The halfing is trembling in fear as Lorroakan directs the armour.NodeContext: [Wilson] for this line, make sure the 1st pose is exactly the same as HUM_M_Rig_SCENE_LOW_SorcerousSundries_Lorroakan_DirectArmour (ends at 8s)

218.speaker: Miklaur
218.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Krank is trying to balance an apple on his headNodeContext: Terrified - voice trembling.

180.speaker: Lorroakan
180.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] The animated armour raises the bow and aims it at the halfling's head, drawing the string.NodeContext: [Wilson] on Lorrokan part, would want him to have a gesture on his left hand when he says"Krank ready, aim" and hold the last pose sligtly longer around 2 beats.

76.speaker: Lorroakan
76.text: Hm. We have a visitor. At ease. Miklaur - you may go.
76.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [scene] He gestures for the armour to lower the bow and for the halfling to leave. Krank lowers bow, Micklaur leaves.NodeContext: Spots player and sours instantly. 
[Wilson] On Lorrokan part, at the very start have him hold like a beat then proceed with the line.

216.text: I see no Nightsong. Surely you wouldn't have entered my tower without the Nightsong in hand. Surely you wouldn't have wasted my time.
216.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

28.speaker: Lorroakan
28.text: I see no Nightsong. Surely you wouldn't have entered my tower without the Nightsong in hand. Surely you wouldn't have wasted my time.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

207.speaker: Lorroakan
207.text: I see no Nightsong. Surely you wouldn't have entered my tower without the Nightsong in hand. Surely you wouldn't have wasted my time.
207.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: So you're the great wizard Lorroakan? I see your reputation is well earned...
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

187.speaker: Narrator
187.text: *Barely a breath of confusion, before he sees you through your borrowed guise.*
187.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

96.speaker: Lorroakan
96.text: My - could it be? Gale of Waterdeep, here in my tower. I'm surprised you dare show your face after Mystra cast you on the scrap heap.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

144.speaker: Lorroakan
144.text: Well don't stand on ceremony - out with it.
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

44.speaker: Lorroakan
44.text: Well don't stand on ceremony - out with it.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I seek a certain rare tome - concerning Karsus.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

239.speaker: Lorroakan
239.text: You're quite in luck, then - see Tolna downstairs. One such tome is amongst our rarest books.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I acquired the 'The Annals of Karsus' from your bookseller. Did anything strike you as... unusual?
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

176.speaker: Lorroakan
176.text: No more so than the rest of the volatile tomes in Tolna's collection. I had her keep them under lock and key to avoid any mishaps.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: Netherese magic - could it be that a source of it - a significant source - still exists?
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

66.speaker: Lorroakan
66.text: Impossible, I daresay. Something so... unstable can scarcely exist as anything greater than a minute fragment.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

39.speaker: Lorroakan
39.text: Karsus found that out the hard way, and those wonderful flying cities of yore were grounded in a most violent manner. His hubris undid him.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

179.speaker: Lorroakan
179.text: But enough of dusty history - I look to the future.
179.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

134.speaker: Lorroakan
134.text: You know I seek the Nightsong. Do you have it or not?
134.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

22.speaker: Lorroakan
22.text: You know I seek the Nightsong. Do you have it or not?
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

274.speaker: Player
274.text: What do you want with her?
274.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

79.speaker: Player
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

250.speaker: Lorroakan
250.text: 'She'. Then you do know her. You've been to Shar's temple. To the Shadowfell. You've looked upon the Nightsong's face.
250.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

168.speaker: Lorroakan
168.text: Tell me - and choose your next words carefully - where is she now?
168.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: She left after I freed her from Ketheric's thrall. I don't know where she is.
283.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

281.speaker: Player
281.text: Be careful what you wish for. She'll eat you alive.
281.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Why do you want her so badly?
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

231.speaker: Lorroakan
231.text: I'm growing tired of this repartee, my friend. Let us cut to the chase.
231.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

58.speaker: Lorroakan
58.text: Beautiful, isn't it? Worth more than your life, too. I bought it from a Calishite warlock with very little of his soul left to him.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

184.speaker: Lorroakan
184.text: It can bind a celestial to the wearer's service with a snap of the fingers.
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: He gestures to the spell circle on the ground - same as the one Ketheric used used to bind Nightsong in Act 2

278.speaker: Lorroakan
278.text: And this? This can keep her in place. Forever.
278.context: CinematicNodeContext: He gestures to the spell circle on the ground - same as the one Ketheric used used to bind Nightsong in Act 2

202.speaker: Player
202.text: I'll tell her to come here - just to give her the satisfaction of ripping you to shreds.
202.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: A clever contraption. Let me guess: like Ketheric Thorm before you, you wish to become immortal.
86.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

62.speaker: Lorroakan
62.text: It didn't work out for poor Ketheric, did it? He was a fool. A desperate mercenary who whored out his soul to whichever god flattered him.
62.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

77.speaker: Lorroakan
77.text: I serve no god but that which stares back at me in the mirror.
77.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

121.speaker: Lorroakan
121.text: The Nightsong will be put to a grand purpose: equalising man and god. Whoever helps me attain that which I seek will be greatly rewarded.
121.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: There is more to divinity than lifespan. Ensnaring an immortal won't make you a god.
253.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

222.speaker: Lorroakan
222.text: Of course not. But perhaps, after enough lifetimes, I might make a start of it.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: 'Equalising man and god'. Quite the lofty ambition.
194.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

242.speaker: Lorroakan
242.text: I intend to achieve greatness. And I intend to do it for a long, long, long time.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: I've always dreamt of immortality. Your plan is quite clever.
195.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

269.speaker: Lorroakan
269.text: 'Clever' doesn't begin to describe it. What I seek is the greatest ambition possible: to defy the ultimate limitation, transcend the fate that awaits us all.
269.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

282.speaker: Lorroakan
282.text: When I succeed, I may look favourably upon you. If you are a friend along the way, that is.
282.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: He would seek the power of gods for the pettiest of reasons - his own gratification. At least I seek them for the better of all.
271.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

177.speaker: Gale
177.text: He would seek the power of gods for the pettiest of reasons - his own gratification. At least I seek them for the better of all.
177.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

51.speaker: Lorroakan
51.text: What's that? I didn't quite catch the words, but the insolent tone was clear enough.
51.context: NodeContext: Mockingly - he doesn't believe Gale for an instant

173.speaker: Gale
173.text: Pitying, not insolent. You chase one power without knowing an even greater one lies within my reach - the Crown of Karsus.

115.speaker: Gale
115.text: Once we acquire it, your ambitions will be dwarfed. I will be able to stand against Mystra, and wrest her powers from her. For the betterment of all.

52.speaker: Lorroakan
52.text: The Crown of Karsus? Nonsense - even if it still existed, you couldn't possibly handle its power -

224.speaker: Gale
224.text: Perhaps you could not. But Netheril's power is in my blood, and Mystra? I know her in ways that most mortals can only dream of.

273.speaker: Narrator
273.text: *There is only one man who would make such a brazen claim about Mystra. His suspicions confirmed, Lorroakan's curiosity settles into a sneer - this is Gale of Waterdeep. However else he might appear.*

93.speaker: Lorroakan
93.text: Ah. So it is you. Mystra's discarded lapdog. And now you think your bark is cause to make me tremble.

104.speaker: Gale
104.text: There is no need for me to bark. My actions will speak for themselves, in time.
104.context: NodeContext: He does believe it, but he's blustering now

141.speaker: Lorroakan
141.text: Then go - act. I'll open a fine vintage in your name, once word of your failure reaches me.

133.speaker: Gale
133.text: Perhaps it was indeed wise to dissuade me from the Crown of Karsus - a jumped-up wizard drunk on promises of power is not enviable company.
133.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

198.speaker: Lorroakan
198.text: What's that? I didn't quite catch the words, but your tone was clear enough.

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: Nothing at all, friend. I was merely admiring your ambition.

169.speaker: Narrator
169.text: *His suspicions confirmed, his curiosity settles into a sneer - he has seen through Gale's disguise.*

244.speaker: Lorroakan
244.text: Ah. I believe I recognise you. Gale of Waterdeep. Mystra's discarded lapdog, reduced to trailing after some adventurer. How you have fallen.

208.speaker: Lorroakan
208.text: Do you still pine for her? Run around trying to impress her, in the hope she'll take you back?

75.speaker: Gale
75.text: I'm my own man. I make my own choices.

95.speaker: Gale
95.text: Let him chase his prize if he wishes. We know of an even greater one that he is blind to - the Crown.
95.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

223.speaker: Gale
223.text: Nothing, friend. Just a little trapped wind - I'm sure you understand.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: You're an arrogant fool. Immortality alone does not make a god.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: 'Equalising man and god' - noble words cannot hide a selfish intent, wizard.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'll go fetch her. I look forward to my reward.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I know where she is. I might even be willing to tell you.
36.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

270.speaker: Player
270.text: You'd give up her location, just like that? You're not actually considering betraying her, are you...?
270.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

259.speaker: Gale
259.text: You'd give up her location, just like that? You're not actually considering betraying her, are you...?
259.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

71.speaker: Player
71.text: That was more than he strictly needed to know. You're not intending to surrender her over to him, are you...?
71.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

159.speaker: Shadowheart
159.text: That was more than he strictly needed to know. You're not intending to surrender her over to him, are you...?
159.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Aylin is a friend - to whom we owe our lives, I would remind you.
83.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

124.speaker: Jaheira
124.text: Aylin is a friend - to whom we owe our lives, I would remind you.
124.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

240.speaker: Player
240.text: You would betray Dame Aylin? Be you faithless, or simply foolish?
240.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

256.speaker: Minsc
256.text: You would betray Dame Aylin? Be you faithless, or simply foolish?
256.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Why tell him anything of Dame Aylin? Surely you do not intend to betray her...?
163.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

246.speaker: Halsin
246.text: Why tell him anything of Dame Aylin? Surely you do not intend to betray her...?
246.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Are you serious? Surely you won't hand Dame Aylin over to him.
205.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

276.speaker: Wyll
276.text: Are you serious? Surely you won't hand Dame Aylin over to him.
276.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

12.speaker: Player
12.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

238.speaker: Karlach
238.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Ha! Betraying so quickly? Be careful your backstabbing arm doesn't get tired.
136.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

262.speaker: Lae'zel
262.text: Ha! Betraying so quickly? Be careful your backstabbing arm doesn't get tired.
262.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Quick to hand someone over, aren't you?
7.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: Quick to hand someone over, aren't you?
84.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Surrendering a powerful ally to this preening wizard does not seem wise.
89.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

90.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
90.text: Surrendering a powerful ally to this preening wizard does not seem wise.
90.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Ambitious wizards and vast power can be a dangerous mix. Careful what you share with him.
142.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

100.speaker: Gale
100.text: Ambitious wizards and vast power can be a dangerous mix. Careful what you share with him.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: She deserves better than to fall into his clutches. I owe her, in a sense.
260.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

137.speaker: Shadowheart
137.text: She deserves better than to fall into his clutches. I owe her, in a sense.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Would you hand her over to have her wings pulled off by this self-inflated wretch?
56.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

268.speaker: Jaheira
268.text: Would you hand her over to have her wings pulled off by this self-inflated wretch?

228.speaker: Player
228.text: You would betray Dame Aylin? Be you faithless, or simply foolish?

37.speaker: Minsc
37.text: You would betray Dame Aylin? Be you faithless, or simply foolish?

199.speaker: Player
199.text: You broke Dame Aylin's shackles once before. Do not help this one to forge new ones for her.
199.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

156.speaker: Halsin
156.text: You broke Dame Aylin's shackles once before. Do not help this one to forge new ones for her.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: Please - you can't liberate Aylin from one master only to chain her to another.
261.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

85.speaker: Wyll
85.text: Please - you can't liberate Aylin from one master only to chain her to another.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: You better not be planning on giving her up. Not after everything she's been through.
212.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

245.speaker: Karlach
245.text: You better not be planning on giving her up. Not after everything she's been through.
245.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: Ha! Betraying so quickly? Be careful your backstabbing arm doesn't get tired.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: Ha! Betraying so quickly? Be careful your backstabbing arm doesn't get tired.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Good. Then you'll have no trouble fulfilling the contract to bring the Nightsong here.

94.speaker: Lorroakan
94.text: Good. Then you'll have no trouble fulfilling the contract to bring the Nightsong here.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: I'll tell her to come here - just to give her the satisfaction of ripping you to shreds.

23.speaker: Lorroakan
23.text: Do as I say, and you'll be rewarded beyond imagination. Fail, and you give up the prize to the next motivated mercenary to encounter my contract.

74.speaker: Lorroakan
74.text: The choice is yours, but make no mistake: I always get what I want.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Dame Aylin is going to want to kick this guy's arse herself. Believe me.
27.context: NodeContext: irritated, but prioritising tactical considerations

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: Dame Aylin is going to want to kick this guy's arse herself. Believe me.
41.context: NodeContext: irritated, but prioritising tactical considerations

19.speaker: Jaheira
19.text: Much as it pleases me to cause an archmage's tantrum, let us be sure we are ready to weather it - yes?
19.context: NodeContext: irritated, but prioritising tactical considerations

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Have it your way. I'll bring her here.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: Have it your way. I'll bring her here.

272.speaker: Lorroakan
272.text: Good. I was growing scared for you. The last person who disappointed me is suffering for it still.

178.speaker: Lorroakan
178.text: Do not return without my prize. Do you hear me? Good day.

99.speaker: Lorroakan
99.text: You aren't the only one who knows what's on offer for the Nightsong's retrieval. Consider carefully whether you'd like to see your fortune in someone else's hands.

65.speaker: Lorroakan
65.text: Someone who might slip into your camp at any moment, or harry you through street and inn until you're run ragged and surrender.

123.speaker: Lorroakan
123.text: The choice is yours: fortune or imminent death. I know you'll choose wisely.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: You heard me. The answer is no.

101.speaker: Lorroakan
101.text: Pity. Then again, perhaps word of your agonising death will draw your little friend to me.

25.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
25.text: We should kill this petulant wizard on our own terms, and allow Nightsong the pleasure of taking his head. Do not provoke him.
25.context: NodeContext: irritated, but prioritising tactical considerations

53.speaker: Lae'zel
53.text: Just smile and nod. We'll decide at our own leisure, not his.
53.context: NodeContext: 'this one' being lorroakan, who is asking the player to betray an ally to him

64.speaker: Wyll
64.text: The wizard's a veritable geyser of rage. Provoke him, and he'll erupt.
64.context: NodeContext: 'this one' being lorroakan, who is asking the player to betray an ally to him

143.speaker: Shadowheart
143.text: We can't do that - not after the lengths I already went through with her.
143.context: NodeContext: 'this one' being lorroakan, who is asking the player to betray an ally to him

181.speaker: Gale
181.text: A shame to wizardry, this one. Still, we should exercise caution.
181.context: NodeContext: 'this one' being lorroakan, who is asking the player to betray an ally to him

186.speaker: Astarion
186.text: We're all very impressed by your loyalty, but have we considered not aggravating the incredibly powerful archmage?
186.context: NodeContext: 'this one' being lorroakan, who is asking the player to betray an ally to him

196.speaker: Minsc
196.text: I will admit I have not listened to a single thing the ginger wizard has said. But I do not like the way he says it.
196.context: NodeContext: 'this one' being lorroakan, who is asking the player to betray an ally to him

251.speaker: Halsin
251.text: I'm glad you will not surrender an ally, but we should still be cautious around this one.
251.context: NodeContext: 'this one' being lorroakan, who is asking the player to betray an ally to him

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I'll fetch her. I look forward to my reward.

266.speaker: Player
266.text: I do admire your directness, though. Quick and to the point.

191.speaker: Astarion
191.text: I do admire your directness, though. Quick and to the point.

209.speaker: Player
209.text: I have little affection for Nightsong, but I would have less for you if you gave her up without a fight.

110.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
110.text: I have little affection for Nightsong, but I would have less for you if you gave her up without a fight.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I'm sorry to tell you, but she's dead. Run through with a Sharran spear.
47.context: NodeContext: He's just learned Nightsong is dead and is upset.

265.speaker: Lorroakan
265.text: Dead?! That cannot be. She - it - is immortal. A god!
265.context: NodeContext: He's just learned Nightsong is dead and is upset.

102.speaker: Lorroakan
102.text: Dead?! That cannot be. She - it - is immortal. A god!
102.context: NodeContext: He's just learned Nightsong is dead and is upset.

103.speaker: Player
103.context: NodeContext: He's just learned Nightsong is dead and is upset.

210.speaker: Lorroakan
210.text: You don't know what you've done. And you never will.

57.speaker: Lorroakan
57.text: How exhausting it is, interacting with inferior minds and their vulgar motivations.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: She was a Selûnite held by Sharrans. Her death was inevitable.
91.context: NodeContext: He's just learned Nightsong is dead and is upset.

16.speaker: Lorroakan
16.text: Is that meant to be some consolation? She - it - was the key to my immortality.
16.context: NodeContext: He's just learned Nightsong is dead and is upset.

213.speaker: Lorroakan
213.text: How can this be - how can this be?! SHIT!
213.context: NodeContext: He's just learned Nightsong is dead and is upset.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: She's been buried. Ended. Taken down. Offed. She's dead.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I'm afraid the mighty Nightsong was no match for my magic. She's dead.

82.speaker: Lorroakan
82.text: You seem to know a great deal about her. Bring her to me, and I'll forgive your little fib about her fate.

21.text: You seem to know a great deal about her. Bring her to me, and I'll forgive your little fib about her fate.

232.speaker: Lorroakan
232.text: You seem to know a great deal about her. Bring her to me, and I'll forgive your little fib about her fate.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: I regret to inform you the Nightsong is no more - killed in the Sharran temple where she was held.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I've seen her - she was trapped by Ketheric Thorm. I left her there.

55.speaker: Lorroakan
55.text: You left her there?! Then go retrieve her, you imbecile. Or it will cost you a world of riches so vast you cannot even comprehend the loss.

122.speaker: Lorroakan
122.text: You left her there?! Then go retrieve her, you imbecile. Or it will cost you a world of riches so vast you cannot even comprehend the loss.

154.speaker: Lorroakan
154.text: You can go now. Before I lose my temper.

166.text: Tut tut, now. I do detest a liar.

275.speaker: Lorroakan
275.text: Tut tut, now. I do detest a liar.

108.speaker: Lorroakan
108.text: She must be an ally for you to try to mislead me. Bring her to me, and I'll forgive this momentary lapse of character.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Get out of my face now.

81.speaker: Lorroakan
81.text: I can see you're in no place to have a civilised conversation. Return when an iota of sense has returned to you.

49.speaker: Lorroakan
49.text: I can see you're in no place to have a civilised conversation. Return when an iota of sense has returned to you.

50.text: Choose your next words carefully, friend. They determine the length of your very life.

106.speaker: Lorroakan
106.text: Choose your next words carefully, friend. They determine the length of your very life.

138.speaker: Lorroakan
138.text: You will bring me the Nightsong. Won't you?

284.speaker: Player
284.text: Binding the Nightsong forever... How unoriginal. Need I recite the tale of Ketheric Thorm?

183.speaker: Player
183.text: First Ketheric, now you - there are easier ways to achieve immortality, you know.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: First Ketheric and now you. I thought wizards were supposed to be the smart ones?

167.speaker: Player
167.text: I know nothing. I swear it.

119.text: Ach! Worthless. Leave, then. And do not return unless you bring the Nightsong in tow. It's not too late for you to become very rich. But you'll have to earn it.

258.speaker: Lorroakan
258.text: Ach! Worthless. Leave, then. And do not return unless you bring the Nightsong in tow. It's not too late for you to become very rich. But you'll have to earn it.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: I do. And I can hand her over, for the right price.

277.speaker: Lorroakan
277.text: Finally. I've been waiting for someone with any measure of wits to heed my clarion call.

17.speaker: Lorroakan
17.text: It's quite simple. Bring the Nightsong here, and collect your reward.

227.speaker: Player
227.text: Why do you want her so badly?

68.speaker: Player
68.text: A clever contraption. Let me guess: like Ketheric Thorm before you, you wish to become immortal.

279.speaker: Player
279.text: Thanks for revealing your plan. I look forward to watching Dame Aylin rip you to shreds.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: That's an awful fate. I won't subject my friend to it.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I couldn't bring her to you even if I wanted to.

197.speaker: Lorroakan
197.text: So was it you who picked up Nightsong's trail? I suppose you still have some talents, even if you are damaged goods. Where is it?

204.speaker: Player
204.text: I might tell you. But there is another matter I wished to ask you about.

249.speaker: Player
249.text: You stand in the presence of Gale of Waterdeep, Lorroakan. Mind your tongue.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Not quite the enthusiastic welcome I was hoping for.

45.speaker: Lorroakan
45.text: You'll have more gratitude than you know how to count once the Nightsong is in my hands. Do you have it or not?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: What do you want with her?

129.speaker: Lorroakan
129.text: 'Her'. Fascinating. You've been to Shar's temple, haven't you? To the Shadowfell?

35.speaker: Lorroakan
35.text: I can take my answers from your corpse if you prefer. A surprising number of people are more forthcoming dead than alive.

48.speaker: Lorroakan
48.text: Then again, who will clean the mangled mess from my floor? So I'll ask again.

226.speaker: Lorroakan
226.text: And the Nightsong? Speak true, now, for I detest a liar.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: You speak as though you've seen the Nightsong yourself.

46.speaker: Lorroakan
46.text: Alas. I've paid for a good deal of very privileged information. Now I await the results of the generous contract I've commissioned.

9.speaker: Lorroakan
9.text: Answer now, or see what happens when fools misuse my valuable time.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You must be the wizard Lorroakan.

236.speaker: Lorroakan
236.text: And you must have an answer to my request - if you want to keep your head, of course. The Nightsong. Do you have it or not?

40.speaker: Lorroakan
40.text: I see no Nightsong. Surely you wouldn't have entered my tower without the Nightsong in hand. Surely my worthless apprentice wouldn't have allowed you to waste my time.

111.speaker: Lorroakan
111.text: Your terrible tidings have cost me everything - my grand design, dashed to ruins.
111.context: NodeContext: The charisma fails; being a big brat

118.speaker: Lorroakan
118.text: You have a job to do. So do it - quickly.
118.context: NodeContext: The charisma fails; being a big brat

131.speaker: Lorroakan
131.text: Bring me what I seek - and quickly - or do not come back. Ever.
131.context: NodeContext: The charisma fails; being a big brat

114.speaker: Lorroakan
114.context: NodeContext: The charisma fails; being a big brat

267.speaker: Lorroakan
267.text: Mark my words: the Nightsong is mine. With or without your help, she will ascend to her grand fate here, in this tower.

112.speaker: Lorroakan
112.text: You can get very rich along the way, or let someone else take what's rightfully yours. Choose wisely.

148.speaker: Lorroakan
148.text: You must be the wizard Lorroakan. I've heard a great deal about you.

263.speaker: Lorroakan
263.text: You must be the wizard Lorroakan. I've heard a great deal about you.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: You must be the wizard Lorroakan. I've heard a great deal about you.
